Author: Holiday-Book6635

Comment: While this is a very encouraging rejection of extremist politics, everyone should be careful about dancing on graves. I know if the tables were turned, people wouldn't likely be so thoughtful. But we're dealing with an ideology built on fear, this is not a rational platform. It is a viewpoint built on the idea of being "erased" in favor of "others." Mustn't stoke the fear further, this is an opportunity to lead by example. And that example should not be two middle fingers held high in their faces.   Trust me, I'd love to have that attitude, but the only way out of this mess is through engagement, not through alienation. Certain mindsets have no place in modern politics, and they will see themselves out, but only if we show them it doesn't have to be like that. I know this isn't a particularly popular opinion now-a-days, but I promise, the alternative is only further division and entrenched hatred. That should not be anyone's goal.
